body:
Ok!
This is the problem :
I have to cast the result of mapping to INodeModel
AND
With your workaround the mapper create a Proxy of INodeModel(T)
AND
Of course i can't cast it to INodeModel becuase it's NOT an INodeModel
So
Is there any mapping to force the Mapper to create a NodeModel(T) Not a Proxy?
It thought it would work with As in the interface map, but for some reason it doesn't. Another workaround is to rename the ID property in INodeModel.

'to rename the ID property in INodeModel' of course i cant because it will loose its reason to be ( please refer to 'IEnumerable(T)' and  'IEnumerable' implementation [here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3848287/what-does-the-source-code-for-ienumerable-look-like) )
So 
I appreciated if you fix this problem in next release
INodeModel is explicitly implemented so I don't see a problem renaming it, but you should know :)

Ohhhhh the interface shadows the base one. That's a bit odd.

So what should the proxy type do exactly? What would you like on-the-fly proxy class look like?
If I may...:) I guess the problem is that the proxy generator doesn't really try to implement the interface. It checks for this case and bails. It should explicitly implement the mismatched members.

While I see your point, I think the best solution is getting As to work

```
 cfg.CreateMap(typeof(NodeDto<>), typeof(INodeModel<>)).As(typeof(NodeModel<>));
```

Then why even have the interface? I'm also missing the context here of WHY you'd want to map directly to the interface, as opposed to the concrete type and then just have the app return an interface if that's important.
Yeah, I'm not sure about that either :)
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
